sentences.english: This cook-shop was kept by some people named Thenardier, husband and wife.
sentences.chinese: 这客店是名叫德纳第的夫妇俩开的。

sentences.english: Different inns display general character in management. First, they are gradational.
sentences.chinese: 明清时期不同种类的客店在经营中表现出一定的共性。

sentences.english: There are guides and wayside inns along the road.
sentences.chinese: 沿途都有向导和客店为我们预备着。

sentences.english: Pardon me, monsieur the inn-keeper, but what is your name?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，客店老板先生，您贵姓？

sentences.english: This was the same mourning suit which he had made her put on when shehad quitted the Thenardiers' inn.
sentences.chinese: 那还是在她离开德纳第客店时他替她穿上的那身丧服。

sentences.english: That inn of theirs is a sort of a cook-shop.
sentences.chinese: 那种客店也只能算是一种歇马店罢了。

sentences.english: Next day, I went to the Admiral Benbow and said goodbye to my mother.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，我回到本葆将军客店和我妈妈道别。

sentences.english: As a result, they agreed that the inn by the boss Li to keep this group a sum of money.
sentences.chinese: 于是，他们商定，由客店老板李振群来保管这一笔钱。

sentences.english: So extras were found at a halfway house, some of them real-life ex-cons.
sentences.chinese: 所以就在一家小客店里找了许多临时演员。

sentences.english: Nothing is more common than a cart or a truck at the door of a hostelry.
sentences.chinese: 一个客店门前停辆榻车或小车原是件最平常的事。

sentences.english: He ran to the inn. The door was barred.
sentences.chinese: 他又跑到客店，客店的门又拴上了。

sentences.english: He ran to the inn. The door was barred.
sentences.chinese: 他又跑到客店，客店的门又拴上了。

sentences.english: This tendency displays obviously in the broker house.
sentences.chinese: 在牙行客店中这一趋势表现得更为明显。

definition: (old) (in a tavern or inn etc) waiter/attendant
customer area of a store/showroom/dining area of a restaurant
to stop for a snack while traveling
